q: begins its story with Donald Rumsfeld 's account about being told by President Bush , two weeks after the 9/11 attacks, to prepare review the Pentagon's plans for a war with Iraq. According to the Times: Two weeks after the worst terrorist attack in our nation's history, those of us in the Department of Defense were fully occupied, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld recalls. But the president insisted on new military plans for Iraq, Mr. Donald Rumsfeld writes. "He wanted the options to be` creative."

Stephen Elop the optimist In a press conference today, Stephen Elop and Steve Ballmer touted the alliance as good for both companies' aspirations. A pessimist sees the difficulty in every opportunity, but an optimist sees the opportunity in every difficulty, Stephen Elop said, quoting England's historic prime minister Winston Churchill as he spoke in London. go home. 11.03 am: Two gilded wooden statues of Tutankhamun are among 18 items missing from the Egyptian museum in Cairo, after looters stole several items during the anti-government protests, the Associated Press reports. On January 28, looters climbed a fire escape to the museum roof and lowered themselves on ropes from a glass pane ceiling onto the museum's top floor. Around 70 objects were damaged, but until Sunday's announcement, it was not known whether anything was missing. Antiquities Minister Zahi Hawass said the museum's database department determined 18 objects were gone. Investigators were

The letter must have come from the State Department itself, Donald Rumsfeld says. How could anyone believe that you couldn't remember if you delivered a letter from Ronald Reagan to Saddam Hussein ? he says.
